text: Dighton is a city in Lane County, Kansas, United States. It is also the county seat of Lane County. In 2020, 960 people lived there. Dighton is named after Dick Dighton, a surveyor. ==Geography== Dighton is at (38.48101, -100.466367). It is at the intersection of K-96 and K-23. The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 960 people, 461 households, and 244 families living in Dighton. Of the households, 75.5% owned their home and 24.5% rented their home. The median age was 48.5 years. Of the people, 88.4% were White, 0.4% were Native American, 0.2% were Pacific Islanders, 4.4% were from some other race, and 6.6% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 11.3% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 1,038 people, 506 households, and 282 families living in Dighton. ==Education== Dighton USD 482 Public Schools has two schools in Dighton. They are the Dighton Jr/Sr High School and the Dighton Elementary School. The Lane County Library is in Dighton. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * City of Dighton * Dighton - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 482 , local school district ;Historical * Early Dighton photos from Wichita State University Libraries Special Collections ;Maps * Dighton City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Kansas Category:County seats in Kansas
title: Dighton, Kansas
